title: I was permabanned?
body: So, I was flaming my friend in game, who I know IRL. I was playing very poorly and was saying stuff like "wow noob jg no ganks" which I know may seem bad, but I knew I was playing bad and I didnt actually mean it. This guy knew I was joking, but the other members of my team didn't, and they might have reported me, idk. Anyways, I queue up and next thing I know, I'm permabanned! Even if I was being serious, this is the first time i've ever gotten banned before, ever. I don't think it should be as serious as a permaban, plus I didn't even mean what I was saying. If this get's enough replies, I'll get my friend to send a message and show a chat log of what happened. I've had this account for 3 years and I don't want to lose it.

If your behavior is severe enough you can skip chat restrictions and a temporary ban and get permabanned, and typically that's from hate speech or threats. Even if you are speaking to someone that is ok with that, you have to be considerate of the other players; regardless of whether they are the target it often creates a negative experience for them, or they may even report you for the sake of the other players.

At the very least, have your friend let the other players know you are both ok with it, but if they still don't appreciate it you should cut it out. I recommend using third party communication options so that it stays isolated from the other players (such as speaking over Skype).

If you wish to contest the ban you'd need to submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

Yes that's what I'm telling you, if that's how you want to put it. You aren't bound by the standards of your two-man premade, but the rules of the game which you can find [here in the Summoner's Code](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/).

Again, I suggest communicating in a way that is not disruptive for the other players. If you don't mind behavior like that from other players that's ok, you don't have to report it, but the rest of the community typically doesn't want to deal with it. If you are in a 5-man premade (or whatever full size is) and they are all ok with it, then you can say whatever you want in team chat as long as they don't report you.
